data.event: Franklin was first settled by Europeans in 1660 and officially incorporated during the American Revolution.

event.title: was formed from the western part of the town of Wrentham on February 16, 1778

data.event: The town was formed from the western part of the town of Wrentham on February 16, 1778; its designated name at incorporation was to be Exeter.
On November 20, 1790, it was decided that the volumes would be lent to the residents of Franklin for free via its library, which has been in operation since then.
The Ray Memorial Library building was dedicated in 1904.

event.title: 1990, on the library's bicentennial, its staff published

data.event: In 1990, on the library's bicentennial, its staff published a booklet, "A History of America's First Public Library at Franklin Massachusetts, 1790 ~ 1990" to commemorate America's first public library and book collection.
